snippet: When two men escaped from Clinton Correctional Facility, high in the Adirondacks, they emerged into a world in which some of the best tracking targets available — cellphones, cars and credit cards — may not apply.
abstract: Law enforcement agencies cast wide net searching rural communities near Dannamora, NY, site of Clinton Correctional Facility in Adirondack Mountains, for escaped convicts and murderers David Sweat and Richard W Matt; Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces $100,000 reward for fugitives, who chiseled their way out of maximum-security prison and remain at large.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Dannemora, and J. David Goodman from New York. Tatiana Schlossberg and Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York. Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: When two men escaped from Clinton Correctional Facility, high in the Adirondacks, they emerged into a world in which some of the best tracking targets available — cellphones, cars and credit cards — may not apply.

headline.main: Wide Net Cast for Escaped Killers; They Could Be ‘Anywhere’
headline.print_headline: Wide Net Cast for Escaped Killers; They Could Be ‘Anywhere’
